Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the impact of the proposed gun control legislation by stating that it will outlaw practically every firearm, make individuals pay $100 per firearm, and put them into a police database. While the legislation does require firearm registration and a fee, it does not outlaw every firearm.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement in the provided claim.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that the proposed legislation will make it "nearly impossible" to get a permit to carry a concealed weapon. It only mentions concerns raised by gun advocates regarding the discretion of the attorney general in issuing permits.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the proposed gun control legislation will eliminate the 2nd Amendment as we know it, which is a problematic assumption as the legislation does not explicitly aim to do so.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no alternative explanation provided in the claim.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the proposed legislation would not inherently make the permit to carry a concealed weapon "nearly impossible" to get, as it only raises concerns about the discretion of the attorney general in issuing permits.
